plan.title: Fix os.fchmod() Windows compatibility
plan.problem: os.fchmod() is Unix-only and causes AttributeError on Windows
tdd_sequence: RED: Create test that simulates Windows environment (no os.fchmod)
GREEN: Add hasattr(os, 'fchmod') check with Windows fallback
VERIFY: Run pytest and ruff to ensure all tests pass
verification_commands: uv run ruff check src/flywheel/storage.py tests/test_issue_2693_windows_fchmod.py
